node.title: Author of Interview with the Vampire, Anne Rice, dies aged 80
node.description: Ms Rice, whose books sold more than 150 million copies,Â died due to complications from a stroke, her son Christopher Rice announced on Facebook and Twitter.
node.content: ["Author Anne Rice, best known for writing Interview with the Vampire which\u00a0was turned into a Hollywood film, has died\u00a0at the age of 80.", "Ms Rice's books sold more than 150 million copies, making her one of the most popular and best-selling authors in literary history.", "She was acclaimed\u00a0for her series of novels, The Vampire Chronicles.", "Ms Rice died due to complications from a stroke, her son Christopher Rice announced on her Facebook page and his Twitter page.", "\"In her final hours, I sat beside her hospital bed in awe of her accomplishments and her courage,\" Mr\u00a0Rice wrote in the statement.", "A Gothic novelist, Ms\u00a0Rice wrote Interview with the Vampire in 1976.", "It was\u00a0adapted into a movie starring Tom Cruise and Brad Pitt in 1994.", "It is\u00a0also in the planning stages\u00a0to be portrayed in a TV series in 2022.", "Ms\u00a0Rice was expected to be interred during a private ceremony at a family mausoleum in New Orleans on an undisclosed date, according to the statement.", "A public celebration of life was to take place next year.", "Apart from Interview with the Vampire, Queen of the Damned was also adapted for a film from The Vampire Chronicles.", "Ms Rice also wrote erotic fiction under the pen names of A\u00a0N\u00a0Roquelaure and Anne Rampling, including Exit to Eden, which was\u00a0adapted into a 1994 film.", "She was widowed in 2002 when her husband of 41 years \u2014 poet and painter Stan Rice \u2014 died from brain cancer at the age of 60.", "With\u00a0Christopher, now 43, enjoying success as an author, Ms Rice's other child,\u00a0Michele, died of leukemia at the age of 5.", "AP/ABC"]
